hints.content: Equivalent fractions cover the same area of the whole.

Let's represent $\dfrac{1}{4}$ using a visual model.

![rectangle with 1 of 4 equal parts shaded, with each part labeled 1 fourth.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/f7ddf8c939d7e89178d1e60687e729b8c982e151)

We need $2$ parts in the equivalent fraction to cover the same area as $\dfrac{1}{\blueD{4}}$.

![rectangle with 1 of 4 equal parts shaded, with each part labeled 1 fourth.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/f7ddf8c939d7e89178d1e60687e729b8c982e151)  
![same-sized rectangle with 2 of an unknown number of equal parts shaded, each labeled 1 over unknown number.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/0e959a9cca19c8808f5b3a520a073b9a58821888)

How many equal parts should the equivalent fraction have?

We need $\maroonD{8}$ equal parts per whole.

![rectangle with 1 of 4 equal parts shaded, with each part labeled 1 fourth.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/f7ddf8c939d7e89178d1e60687e729b8c982e151)  
![same-sized rectangle with 2 of 8 equal parts shaded, with each part labeled 1 eighth.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/36ca9771d8eede22007715f1e2af81d0a0ba97b8)

$\dfrac{1}{4} = \dfrac{2}{\maroonD{8}}$

question.content:
**What value of $w$ makes the equation true?**

 $\dfrac{1}{4} = \dfrac{2}{w}$

$w=$ [[â˜ƒ numeric-input 1]]
